intro: Vincetoxicum jaliscense, commonly known as Mexican snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its roots contain toxic compounds, which have been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes. Vincetoxicum jaliscense is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
